Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
jabber
<networking> An event that occurs when a device on a network using the {LAT} {protocol} continues to broadcast its availability even though its availability status is known by the network.
(1996-05-10)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Jabber \Jab"ber\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Jabbered}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Jabbering}.] [Cf. {Gibber}, {Gabble}.] To talk rapidly, indistinctly, or unintelligibly; to utter gibberish or nonsense; to chatter. --Swift. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Jabber \Jab"ber\, v. t. To utter rapidly or indistinctly; to gabble; as, to jabber French. --Addison. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Jabber \Jab"ber\, n. Rapid or incoherent talk, with indistinct utterance; gibberish. --Swift. [1913 Webster]
jabber n : rapid and indistinct speech [syn: {jabbering}, {gabble}] v : talk in a noisy, excited, or declamatory manner [syn: {rant}, {mouth off}, {spout}, {rabbit on}, {rave}]
